docs.abstract: We don’t want to leave the world a worse place than we found it.
docs.snippet: We don’t want to leave the world a worse place than we found it.
docs.lead_paragraph: Neil Young and Joni Mitchell did more than go after Spotify for spreading Covid disinformation last week. They also, inadvertently, signaled what could turn out to be an extraordinarily important revival: of an older generation fully rejoining the fight for a working future.

headline.main: Call It ‘Codger Power.’ We’re Older and Fighting for a Better America.

byline.original: By Bill McKibben and Akaya Windwood

docs.abstract: “What makes a dance queer?” was one of many questions considered at Explode! Queer Dance, a festival that brought together artists and academics.
docs.snippet: “What makes a dance queer?” was one of many questions considered at Explode! Queer Dance, a festival that brought together artists and academics.
docs.lead_paragraph: As audience members took their seats for the final performance of Explode! Queer Dance on Saturday night, the choreographer, performer and dance scholar Thomas F. DeFrantz roamed among us, collecting suggestions.

headline.main: What Can Queer and Dance Do for Each Other?
headline.print_headline: Watching a Conversation, Not a Competition, Between Men

docs.abstract: How Abraham Foxman, former head of the Anti-Defamation League, became the redemption broker.
docs.snippet: How Abraham Foxman, former head of the Anti-Defamation League, became the redemption broker.
docs.lead_paragraph: It would not be an exaggeration to say that among the managerial class in New York, an anxiety around cancellation has now surpassed any fear of Covid-19. People are at home, restless — scrolling through the past for the potentially offensive gaffe, the expression of an outdated view, the eruption that should have been a gentle reprimand (are reprimands still OK?), the office-party re-enactment of favorite scenes from “Annie Hall.” The revolution — which now extends beyond race to encompass all the ways we communicate across difference — is not interested in your excuses.

headline.main: They Were Canceled. Should He Have Helped Them Come Back?
headline.print_headline: The Way of the Redemption Broker

docs.abstract: Everyone thinks the industry needs to change. They don’t yet agree on how.
docs.snippet: Everyone thinks the industry needs to change. They don’t yet agree on how.
docs.lead_paragraph: On June 1, Tom Ford, the chairman of the Council of Fashion Designers of America, sent a letter to the board about its meeting the next day. He wanted the board to address the Black Lives Matter protests against racial injustice, he said, and systemic racism in the fashion industry.

headline.main: It’s Time to End Racism in the Fashion Industry. But How?
headline.print_headline: Racism in Fashion: How to End It?

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Council of Fashion Designers of America

byline.original: By Salamishah Tillet and Vanessa Friedman

docs.abstract: The officers in Wilmington, N.C., were fired for misconduct. The recording captured one saying, “We are just going to go out and start slaughtering” black people, according to a report.
docs.snippet: The officers in Wilmington, N.C., were fired for misconduct. The recording captured one saying, “We are just going to go out and start slaughtering” black people, according to a report.
docs.lead_paragraph: Three police officers in Wilmington, N.C., were fired after a supervisor found recorded conversations that included racist remarks, slurs and one officer saying he “can’t wait” to start “slaughtering” black people, the department announced Wednesday.

headline.main: Three N.C. Officers Fired After Police Find Racist Comments on Video

docs.abstract: Trump’s America has accelerated “the authoritarian dynamic.”
docs.snippet: Trump’s America has accelerated “the authoritarian dynamic.”
docs.lead_paragraph: In the continuing debate over whether liberals or conservatives are more open minded, whether those on the left or the right are more rigid in their thinking, a team of four Canadian psychologists studied patterns of “cognitive reflection” among Americans.

headline.main: ‘The Whole of Liberal Democracy Is in Grave Danger at This Moment’

docs.abstract: A bill backed by nearly 60 House Democrats would create a panel to develop proposals and a “national apology” to repair the lingering effects of slavery.
docs.snippet: A bill backed by nearly 60 House Democrats would create a panel to develop proposals and a “national apology” to repair the lingering effects of slavery.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — With the support of a string of 2020 Democratic presidential candidates, the idea of reparations for African-Americans is gaining traction among Democrats on Capitol Hill, where Speaker Nancy Pelosi backs the establishment of a commission that would develop proposals and a “national apology” to repair the lingering effects of slavery.

headline.main: House Democrats, With Pelosi’s Support, Will Consider a Commission on Reparations
headline.print_headline: House Democrats Consider Commission on Slavery Reparations

docs.abstract: The U.S.S. Reno flag was anonymously returned with a note that said it “needed protecting.”
docs.snippet: The U.S.S. Reno flag was anonymously returned with a note that said it “needed protecting.”
docs.lead_paragraph: When people broke into City Hall in Reno, Nev., this weekend during protests against police brutality, they smashed windows, set fires and took items from the building — including an American flag from a World War II Navy ship.

headline.main: A World War II Flag Taken During a Reno Protest Is Returned
headline.print_headline: Wartime Flag Is Returned After Protests In Nevada

docs.abstract: Rather than taking things in stride, I’m still saying, “How dare you?”
docs.snippet: Rather than taking things in stride, I’m still saying, “How dare you?”
docs.lead_paragraph: The events of Jan. 6 taste as bitter in my mouth as they did the day they took place. Nearly three months later, the simmering bad feeling isn’t boiling over anymore, but it’s still hot to the touch.

docs.abstract: The season’s latest releases take up the New England Patriots, the origin story of Giannis Antetokounmpo — and the role of discrimination, protests and money in the world of athletics.
docs.snippet: The season’s latest releases take up the New England Patriots, the origin story of Giannis Antetokounmpo — and the role of discrimination, protests and money in the world of athletics.
docs.lead_paragraph: Sports fans can easily forget or dismiss a clear reality about the games they love: They are a form of entertainment, a business endeavor competing among many options for emotional and financial attention.

headline.main: They’ve Got Game: New Sports Books
